editorial.editors_note: The tools of transparency now map not just code but concrete—yet the real question remains whether we’ll use them to patch holes or just admire the cracks.
editorial.emphasis: The weaponization of open data against its own blind spots

top_candidates.original_title: Show HN: Sightline – Shodan-style search for real-world infra using OSM Data
top_candidates.generated_headline: "Sightline" Exposes Physical Infrastructure Like Shodan Exposed Servers—Using OpenStreetMap as the Attack Surface
top_candidates.summary: A new tool called Sightline repurposes OpenStreetMap data to enable Shodan-style reconnaissance of real-world infrastructure—power grids, pipelines, cell towers—with the same ease as scanning IP space. The project’s maintainer frames it as a transparency win, but the same query syntax that reveals vulnerable substations could just as easily map targets for kinetic disruption.

top_candidates.original_title: Show HN: AutoShorts – Local, GPU-accelerated AI video pipeline for creators
top_candidates.generated_headline: AutoShorts: The Local GPU Video Pipeline That Quietly Undermines Cloud Dependence
top_candidates.summary: A new open-source tool, AutoShorts, offers creators a GPU-accelerated, locally hosted alternative to cloud-based video editing—raising questions about whether the tradeoff of self-managed infrastructure will appeal beyond the technically adept. The project’s polished dashboard suggests a rare balance between usability and control, but its long-term viability hinges on whether non-engineers will tolerate the setup overhead.

top_candidates.original_title: Show HN: An interactive map of US lighthouses and navigational aids
top_candidates.generated_headline: Lighthouses Plotted: A Niche Map That Exposes the Gaps in Public Maritime Data
top_candidates.summary: An interactive US lighthouse map surfaces the quiet decay of navigational infrastructure—useful for historians, but its reliance on volunteer-maintained datasets reveals how easily critical wayfinding aids slip through official cracks.
